result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Millard Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Court orders cash bail applied to Court Costs BEFORE resitituion.  Court costs paid in full.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victims or their residences and no violent contact with Jessica M.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Balance of cash bail applied to resitution.  Restitution is ordered to be paid to Steven R. as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber) - STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Wolff.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher J Millard in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count 1. Court conducted plea colloquy with defendant.
Court found defendant guilty of count 1. Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

TERM OF PROBATION:  12 MONTHS; WITHHELD; 2 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  victims or their residences and no violent contact with Jessica M.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $881.31 to Steven R. to be paid as a condition of probation - Balance of posted cash bail to be applied.

COURT COSTS:  $253.00 (includes $10.00 DRGOD assessment) - apply cash bail.

CONDITION TIME: 40 days jail, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 10:00 am
